turn.1: What is the difference between new life and new shares in Reading Scientific Services?
turn.2: Reading Scientific Services Reading Scientific Services Ltd. (RSSL) is a British company providing scientific analysis,consultancy, product development and training to the global food, drink, healthcare, pharmaceutical, biopharmaceutical and consumer goods sectors.
turn.3: Have they been inspected by any regulatory authorities?
turn.4: It has been inspected by regulatory authorities including the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), the Medicines and Healthcare products Regulatory Agency (MHRA) and the United Kingdom Accreditation Service (UKAS).
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: RSSL was formed in 1987 out of Cadbury Schweppes Research and Development.
turn.7: Is it still part of Cadbury?
turn.8: It is a wholly owned subsidiary of Mondelēz_International.
turn.10: RSSL is based at two sites on the Whiteknights Campus of the University of Reading.
turn.11: Where are the majority of operations located?
turn.12: The headquarters and main laboratories are based at the Reading Science Centre.
